firstNightReminder: Show the marked character token. Point to the marked player.
otherNightReminder: If the Grandmother’s grandchild was killed by the Demon tonight: The Grandmother dies.
name: Grandmother
ability: You start knowing a good player & their character. If the Demon kills them, you die too.

firstNightReminder: The Chambermaid points to two players. Show the number signal (0, 1, 2, …) for how many of those players wake tonight for their ability.
otherNightReminder: The Chambermaid points to two players. Show the number signal (0, 1, 2, …) for how many of those players wake tonight for their ability.
name: Chambermaid
ability: Each night, choose 2 alive players (not yourself): you learn how many woke tonight due to their ability.

firstNightReminder: The Dreamer points to a player. Show 1 good and 1 evil character token; one of these is correct.
otherNightReminder: The Dreamer points to a player. Show 1 good and 1 evil character token; one of these is correct.
name: Dreamer
ability: Each night, choose a player (not yourself or Travellers): you learn 1 good and 1 evil character, 1 of which is correct.

name: Savant
ability: Each day, you may visit the Storyteller to learn 2 things in private: 1 is true & 1 is false.

firstNightReminder: Point to 1 evil player. Wake the townsfolk who is evil and show them the 'You are' card and the thumbs down evil sign.
otherNightReminder: If the known evil player has died, point to another evil player.
name: Bounty Hunter
ability: You start knowing 1 evil player. If the player you know dies, you learn another evil player tonight. [1 Townsfolk is evil]

firstNightReminder: If the cult leader changed alignment, show them the thumbs up good signal of the thumbs down evil signal accordingly.
otherNightReminder: If the cult leader changed alignment, show them the thumbs up good signal of the thumbs down evil signal accordingly.
name: Cult Leader
ability: Each night, you become the alignment of an alive neighbour. If all good players choose to join your cult, your team wins.

name: Atheist
ability: The Storyteller can break the game rules & if executed, good wins, even if you are dead. [No evil characters]

name: Knight
ability: You start knowing two players that are not the demon.

name: Alsaahir
ability: Each day, if you publicly guess which players are Minion(s) and which are Demon(s), good wins.

otherNightReminder: If the Sage was killed by a Demon: Point to two players, one of which is that Demon.
name: Sage
ability: If the Demon kills you, you learn that it is 1 of 2 players.

firstNightReminder: If 7 or more players: Show the Lunatic a number of arbitrary 'Minions', players equal to the number of Minions in play. Show 3 character tokens of arbitrary good characters. If the token received by the Lunatic is a Demon that would wake tonight: Allow the Lunatic to do the Demon actions. Place their 'attack' markers. Wake the Demon. Show the Demon’s real character token. Show them the Lunatic player. If the Lunatic attacked players: Show the real demon each marked player. Remove any Lunatic 'attack' markers.
otherNightReminder: Allow the Lunatic to do the actions of the Demon. Place their 'attack' markers. If the Lunatic selected players: Wake the Demon. Show the 'attack' marker, then point to each marked player. Remove any Lunatic 'attack' markers.
name: Lunatic
ability: You think you are a Demon, but you are not. The Demon knows who you are & who you choose at night.

firstNightReminder: Wake all the Minions, show them the 'This character selected you' card and the Damsel token.
otherNightReminder: If selected by the Huntsman, wake the Damsel, show 'You are' card and a not-in-play Townsfolk token.
name: Damsel
ability: All Minions know you are in play. If a Minion publicly guesses you (once), your team loses.

name: Saint
ability: If you die by execution, your team loses.

firstNightReminder: Show the Grimoire to the Spy for as long as they need.
otherNightReminder: Show the Grimoire to the Spy for as long as they need.
name: Spy
ability: Each night, you see the Grimoire. You might register as good & as a Townsfolk or Outsider, even if dead.

name: Goblin
ability: If you publicly claim to be the Goblin when nominated & are executed that day, your team wins.

firstNightReminder: Wake the Evil Twin and their twin. Confirm that they have acknowledged each other. Point to the Evil Twin. Show their Evil Twin token to the twin player. Point to the twin. Show their character token to the Evil Twin player.
name: Evil Twin
ability: You & an opposing player know each other. If the good player is executed, evil wins. Good can't win if you both live.

otherNightReminder: The Vortox points to a player. That player dies.
name: Vortox
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. Townsfolk abilities yield false info. Each day, if no-one is executed, evil wins.

otherNightReminder: The Fang Gu points to a player. That player dies. Or, if that player was an Outsider and there are no other Fang Gu in play: The Fang Gu dies instead of the chosen player. The chosen player is now an evil Fang Gu. Wake the new Fang Gu. Show the 'You are' card, then the Fang Gu token. Show the 'You are' card, then the thumb-down 'evil' hand sign.
name: Fang Gu
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. The 1st Outsider this kills becomes an evil Fang Gu & you die instead. [+1 Outsider]

firstNightReminder: Place the Leviathan 'Day 1' marker. Announce 'The Leviathan is in play; this is Day 1.'
otherNightReminder: Change the Leviathan Day reminder for the next day.
name: Leviathan
ability: If more than 1 good player is executed, you win. All players know you are in play. After day 5, evil wins.

name: Djinn
ability: Use the Djinn's special rule. All players know what it is.

name: Ferryman
ability: On the final day, all dead players regain their vote token.

name: Doomsayer
ability: If 4 or more players live, each living player may publicly choose (once per game) that a player of their own alignment dies.

name: Sentinel
ability: There might be 1 extra or 1 fewer Outsider in play.

name: Revolutionary
ability: 2 neighboring players are known to be the same alignment. Once per game, one of them registers falsely.

firstNightReminder: Make sure to pay attention to the rules and jinxes.
name: Bootlegger
ability: This script has homebrew characters or rules.

firstNightReminder: Mark a good player as "Safe". Wake each evil player and show them the marked player.
name: Storm Catcher
ability: Name a good character. If in play, they can only die by execution, but evil players learn which player it is.

name: Beggar
ability: You must use a vote token to vote. Dead players may choose to give you theirs. If so, you learn their alignment. You are sober & healthy.

name: Scapegoat
ability: If a player of your alignment is executed, you might be executed instead.

name: Butcher
ability: Each day, after the 1st execution, you may nominate again.

firstNightReminder: Choose a player, wake them and tell them which Barista power is affecting them. Treat them accordingly (sober/healthy/true info or activate their ability twice).
otherNightReminder: Choose a player, wake them and tell them which Barista power is affecting them. Treat them accordingly (sober/healthy/true info or activate their ability twice).
name: Barista
ability: Each night, until dusk, 1) a player becomes sober, healthy and gets true info, or 2) their ability works twice. They learn which.

otherNightReminder: The Harlot points at any player. Then, put the Harlot to sleep. Wake the chosen player, show them the 'This character selected you' token, then the Harlot token. That player either nods their head yes or shakes their head no. If they nodded their head yes, wake the Harlot and show them the chosen player's character token. Then, you may decide that both players die.
name: Harlot
ability: Each night*, choose a living player: if they agree, you learn their character, but you both might die.

name: Voudon
ability: Only you and the dead can vote. They don't need a vote token to do so. A 50% majority is not required.

otherNightReminder: If the Blabber’s public statement was completely true about the game state: Choose a player not protected from dying tonight. That player dies.
name: Blabber
ability: Each day, you may make a public *game-related* statement. Tonight, if it was true *by registration*, a player dies.

otherNightReminder: The Faustian points to a player, and a character on their sheet and/or gives a "good" or "evil" signal. If incorrect, the Faustian dies at night.
name: Faustian
ability: Each night*, choose a player & guess their character *and/or alignment*: if you guess wrong, you die.

otherNightReminder: The previously protected, drunk and deranged players lose those markers. The Adulterator points to two players. Those players are protected. One is drunk this night. The same or the other one is deranged and protected until next dusk.
name: Adulterator
ability: Each night*, choose 2 players: they can't die tonight, 1 is drunk. *1 is deranged and can't die until dusk.*

firstNightReminder: See Other Night Reminder.
otherNightReminder: Let the soulmate choose a person after demon but before minions. When the soulmate chose, it is like the demon tried to kill them. Independent of the success of death, this soulmate loses *all* abilities. At the onset of the vessel effect – as soon as the vessel dies – tell them that the Soulmate chose them. (Do this even if they chose themself.)
name: Soulmate
ability: Each night, choose ≤ 1 person to not trigger effects on death. When you chose, you die and lose *all* abilities! Fixed alignment!

firstNightReminder: Do not inform the Demon/Minions who each other are but prepare 3 bluffs independently for each evil person. The bluffs may overlap.
otherNightReminder: If the Poppy Grower has died, show the Minions/Demon who each other are.
name: Poppy Snitch
ability: Minions & Demons do not know each other *but get 3 independent bluffs*. If you die, minions & demons get to know each other that night.

firstNightReminder: See Other Night Reminder
otherNightReminder: Add the "psyched" reminder to every player who pointed at the enabled Psychic. At the end of the night, if at least 1 player has a "psyched" reminder, wake up the Psychic and show all player with "psyched" reminder to the Psychic. Remove the "psyched" reminders.
name: Psychic
ability: Each dawn, you learn which players pointed at you at night.

firstNightReminder: Invent or devise an ability or discernible modification for a minion character that you want to give to the Deluded. Give correct minion info to the Deluded and treat the Deluded as minion for evil players. Treat the Deluded as evil Townsfolk or Outsider for good players.
otherNightReminder: Play the special ability of the Deluded which is different from their seen minion character. The Deluded registers as evil minion to evil players and as evil Townsfolk or Outsider to good players.
name: Deluded
ability: You register as evil minion to yourself and evil players & as evil non-minion to good players. Secretly, you are good & the minion is unlike your real ability.

firstNightReminder: Add the "instigated" reminder to the player to the left or to the right of the Instigator (when). The instigated player is deranged until next dusk.
otherNightReminder: At dusk, move the "instigated" reminder to the X-th neighbour of the Instigator. The instigated player is deranged until next dusk. Optional rule: You can switch clockwise or counter-clockwise direction any time.
name: Instigator
ability: On night/day X, your X-th neighbour (clockwise or counter-clockwise) is deranged.

firstNightReminder: If you want, you can add 1 extra outsider who is Polymath. If you don't, ignore the Polymath night steps. Tell them, they are the Polymath. The polymath must be good at setup time. You may turn 1 good character player evil, preferably an outsider. Note down what static info you give in-play characters (you'll need to replay the info when the Polymath chooses it).  Choose a fairly compensating not-in-play outsider for the polymath from the script. Show it to the Polymath and put them to sleep. If you think, it's fair for the evil to know, wake the demon and possibly evil players with weak evil value and tell them that the polymath is that outsider. Poisoned minions may get false info. Rest: see Other Night Reminder
otherNightReminder: Present the polymath a script to choose a character from (townsfolk or minion) early in the night, you may disallow choices and prompt to choose again. Disallow any choices that cannot be bluffed by good/evil players or confirm the Polymath player. (For this, remember any Polymath ability choices that you arranged privately at day if applicable.) Sleep. When the Polymath has chosen more abilities than the number of the current day+night cycle, you might add the "overdriven" (= drunk + deranged) reminder to the Polymath player. An overdriven player is either drunk or deranged, whatever helps the opposite team more, else remove the overdriven reminder of the Polymath if applicable. Update your notes about what static info which character gets this night (replay this info to the Polymath when the corresponding character is chosen). Later in the night, play the chosen character (directly after an equal in-play character would play). If you give first night info, it is info that the same character has received most recently. Do not allow the Polymath to change the demon character or person and show no grimoire. Sleep. Finally after dawn, they might choose an ability sometime at the day, directly in a private talk or indirectly via public claim, which is decided the same way as the choice of the night ability. It might work or not. The day phase has a separate once-per-game ability reminder.
name: Polymath
ability: 1 good Townsfolk, knowing it, might turn into an outsider+Polymath at night 1: Each night/day, affected by your state, play ≤1 bluffable townsfolk/minion. You register as evil. The evil *might* know your character. +0/+1 evil players

name: Anarchist
ability: You have any alignment & character type unless you die. The demon & story teller choices don't kill you. You get 1 bluff.

name: Wicked
ability: Whoever wins, loses & whoever loses, wins, even if you are dead, *except if the Story Teller is executed*.
flavor: But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first. (Matthew 30:19)

name: Maverick
ability: When you learn that you died, publicly choose 1 alive player: if they are evil, you *become a Heretic at dusk or dawn and the opposite team learns this*.

otherNightReminder: Before protection characters take effect, add the "drunk" reminder to the Prosecutor when they checked 1 execution at the last day whose executee has had equal alignment. Remove the "drunk" reminder when they lose their ability.
name: Prosecutor
ability: Each day, invoke your ability at ≤ 1 execution. If the executee has your alignment, they don't die & you are drunk from now on. You are the Ogre.

name: Puzzlemaster
ability: 1 player *is/gets the Puzzledrunk*, even if you die. If you guess (once) who it is, learn the Demon player, but guess wrong & get false info (another player). [+1 Puzzledrunk]

firstNightReminder: Choose a character token that should be treated as the Puzzledrunk, as not-in-play, before putting it into the bag. This allows you to put up to one illegal pair of characters in the bag.
otherNightReminder: If the Puzzlemaster guessed publicly or privately the drunk, privately tell them a player name. If their guess is right, the name is correct, else incorrect.
name: Puzzledrunk
ability: The Puzzlemaster's drunk player has or gets this character without knowing it. [Puzzlemaster in play, Sentinel in play]

name: Punk
ability: You have a drunk ability (no Outsider). If you are *guessed* by a good ability, someone *might* die at night. You get the alignment of who kills you.

firstNightReminder: Prepare the setup by replacing any character (and their alignment) with any other character and evil alignment. At dawn 1 (after the first night), add the "sickened" reminder to the affected player.
otherNightReminder: If the Sickener has their ability, don't wake up the player with "sickened" reminder, treat their day actions like a bluff and let their nominations fail covertly or overtly after the voting with no reason. When they die, wake up the Sickener at night. (You may show a death signal.)
name: Sickener
ability: 1 evil player is sick since 1st dawn. You start knowing their character & learn when they die. [+0/+1 of any character type or alignment]

firstNightReminder: Choose N ≤ 3 actually in-play minion characters and 3 - N minions which are not (and possibly a character that other players believe to be in play). Show these 3 to the Fan. Also: let them choose 1 player for their Ogre ability. They get the chosen player's alignment.
otherNightReminder: At day, when the Fan visited you and made a minion guess: when it was right, they get to see the minion character + evil alignment tonight. Change their character to the minion. Otherwise they get to see a good alignment. Indicate the players good alignment in the Grimoire by unflipping the Fan token.
name: Fan
ability: Once per game, guess 1 of 3 initally seen minions which is not in play. If you are right, you get evil + this minion, else you get good. You are an Ogre.

firstNightReminder: The Scaremonger points to a player. Place the Fear token next to that player and declare that a Scaremonger is in play at dawn.
otherNightReminder: The Scaremonger points to a player. Move the Fear token next to that player. Even if the Scaremonger is dead: At the final dawn, if the player with "Fear" reminder lives, declare that they die and end the game.
name: Scaremonger
ability: Each night*, choose 1 player. On the final day, the last chosen player dies even if you are dead. All players know you are in play.

firstNightReminder: Declare that the Panicmonger is in play at dawn. Rest: See Other Night Reminder.
otherNightReminder: The Panicmonger points to a player. Add/Move the "Fury" reminder to that player. Let them point to another player who is good and not a Traveller. Add/Move the "Fear" reminder to that player. If at a day, the player with "fury" executes the player with "fear", show the Grimoire to the Panicmonger at the next night, without any Spy-/Widow-like Jinxes at play.
name: Panicmonger
ability: Each night, choose 1 player, then 1 good non-traveller. If the 1st executes the 2nd with ≥ 5 players alive, evil wins. All players know you are in play.

firstNightReminder: See Other Night reminder.
otherNightReminder: Wait for the demon to kill. Afterwards, if a previously bullied person did not claim their true character, that person dies if the Bully was sober+healthy at dusk. Later after your choice, if the chosen Person registers not in the same team as Bully, mark them "bullied" and Inform the chosen person to be chosen by the Bully.
name: Bully
ability: Each night, choose a player who learns this & dies if they don't claim their true character during next nominations. No effect on your team.

firstNightReminder: Wake up Plotter to choose a character+alignment to register as regarding the game rules (this may affect the minion + demon info step that happens afterwards). Count all outsider tokens in the setup including the puzzledrunk. You can add or remove outsiders arbitrarily. Fabled restrictions on outsiders/evil minions are ignored. First show the minion and demon info. Later, let the plotter choose non-minion players to become new minions of character+alignment they wish (give no feedback if specific wishes fail, i.e. specific players don't change). After demon info: Wake up Plotter and show them 1 not in play townsfolk, 1 not in play outsider (both not demon bluffs) and 1 *in play* minion, whose player the demon didn't get to see. Wake up all outsiders (except this Plotter), let them know the other outsiders and show who is the Plotter. Sleep. Wake up all minions (except this Plotter), let them know the other minions and show them the Plotter. Sleep. Show the demon to only evil minions. Sleep. Wake up the Plotter, show all final minions (no demons). This number of minions is X. Sleep. Rest: see Other Night Reminder.
otherNightReminder: On night X, first make every townsfolk and demon deranged. If there is no outsider in the setup, this never triggers. When the plotter became drunk/poisoned and Spirit of Ivory is in play, turn evil players/minions into good players, as necessary & notify them. Otherwise, even when the Plotter died, don't forget the Plotter decides their registration at the start of the night and each time a new person+ability combination interacts with the Plotter: initially let them choose character+alignment for the game rules. Sleep. Later, wake them up, show them only the character (not the person) and let them respond with an alignment+character. Put them to sleep and continue finishing the ability with your queried information.
name: Plotter
ability: On night X, Townsfolk+demons are deranged until dusk. Even when dead: Townsfolk/demons play vs. outsiders/minions, you poison Spirit of Ivory, choose how to register. Outsiders see you & each other. [X Outsiders]
flavor: I am having a goal! The town of Ravenswood Bluff... WILL BE MINE!!! You shall be fearing me! I HAVE FURY!!

firstNightReminder: See Other Night Reminder.
otherNightReminder: Let them choose 1 player. Move the "whispered" reminder to that player. Players with "whispered" reminder have their final player state effects negated (such that they differ from the unnegated state) but neither the info they get nor any details or ability rules.
name: Whisperer
ability: Each night, choose a player: they are dyseffective until dusk.

firstNightReminder: See Other Night Reminder.
otherNightReminder: Let them choose 1 player except for themself. Move the "jailed" reminder to that player. Players with "jailed" reminder may not change their player state (they cannot die) and cannot act (no waking up at all, actions at day don't work, nominations fail, they cannot vote except for Travellers).
name: Jailer
ability: Each night, choose 1 player (not yourself): they are captive until dusk.

firstNightReminder: See Other Night Reminder
otherNightReminder: Whenever the Tracker's registered or actual character, alignment or player state correctly affected a player's ability since last dawn, add 1 "tracked" reminder to that player (if there is not already 1). At dawn, show all the players with the "tracked" reminder to the Tracker. Remove the "tracked" reminders.
name: Tracker
ability: Each dawn, see all players (not yourself) whose abilities queried your registered or actual player state or properties correctly since last dawn.

firstNightReminder: Devise your setup by starting with only good players and, among them, choose the standard number of good players to become a Legionatic, minus ≥ 0 players who become minions. Choose ≥ 1 Legionatic player to get Legionatic info. Add the "Legionatic" reminder to all Legionatic players. All minions also get it. For the Legionatic Info: Wake up each of them individually (e.g. clockwise). Show them all good players to be good and show them 1 unique not-in-play good character as bluff. Sleep.
otherNightReminder: Choose a player, that player dies. At day, if a nomination gets fake – because no good players voted – treat them as normal but if it gets most of the votes, instead of moving the real "about to die" reminder to it, use the Legionatic's "About to die" reminder and remember the number of votes for both reminders. Later, declare that the player with the real "about to die" reminder is executed.
name: Legionatic
ability: Each night*, 1 player dies. Nominations covertly fail if only evil voted. You have +1 drunk not-in-play ability. Only minions & ≥ 1 Legionatic see the good + 1 bluff. [most players are Legionatic, ? minions]

firstNightReminder: remember: all minions are poisoned. Give this demon only townsfolk bluffs, no outsiders. Show them all in play minion characters on the script. All of them are active since night 1.
otherNightReminder: Wake Pandemon to kill. Sleep. If applicable, wake Pandemon directly before or after *every poisoned* (not just drunk) minion at this night, show them the minion character and let them use this ability now. Sleep. Any ability/rule makes Pandemon register to that ability/rule such that it helps Pandemon's longevity (each time at night and day, you analyse and decide what helps them more to not die! It's about life, not winning!). See, if any *good* character was affected or detected by Pandemon's evilness (even partially, like an Empath getting a 1). If so, before ending the night, wake the demon up and tell them 1 good character, not the player! Pandemon cannot be or become good, no matter what.
name: Pandemon
ability: Each night*, choose a player to kill & learn 1 character detecting you. Has all poisoned minion abilities & arbitrarily registers as minion/demon. You can't be good. [poisoned minions; only townsfolk bluffs]
flavor: I am all evil, even to the evil.

firstNightReminder: After the demon info, let Diabolus choose any players to (mis)register as evil (even Diabolus themself). All others register as good. Afterwards, let Diabolus choose players to misregister as Leviathan (including Diabolus themself). Don't let the players know. Characters that must register as specific alignment (e.g. Pandemon) won't be affected by the chosen registration. Sleep.
otherNightReminder: Don't wake up Diabolus and don't kill.
name: Diabolus
ability: On your 1st night, choose which players register as evil and which as Leviathan. 1 or any more executions may happen at day, else evil wins. [Leviathan on script]

firstNightReminder: Choose one good player to become evil, and possibly a dedicated Townsfolk, Outsider or Minion character, except if just ≤ 5 players are in the game.
otherNightReminder: Let the Putin choose 1 player (dead or alive). Determine the closest evil player (considering only alive players). Start by killing the chosen player then continue to kill the next player towards the next alive evil player until finally the next alive evil player is killed. Ignore all dead players (they are not killed again). If the alive evil player is the Putin themself, then they do not die and only good players do.
name: Putin
ability: Each night*, choose 1 player. From this player to (inclusively) the closest alive evil player, all players die. You cannot kill yourself. [+1 evil]

firstNightReminder: When a good player is executed at day, declare an exile instead and treat it that way, just don't allow dead players to nominate non-travellers. When quitted players nominate, their nomination fails despite successful vote. If the Trump would die while 2 ≥ evil players are alive, the death affects the player instead who would be accountable for the death of the Trump.
otherNightReminder: Let them choose 1 player. Add the "quitted" reminder to this player. Players with quitted reminder cannot do anything except communicating/walking and cannot be affected by any ability or rule. Only when the game ended, count them as players again with the state that they had when they were quitted. Rest: See First Night Reminder.
name: Trump
ability: Each night*, choose 1 player: if good they quit. Good players are exiled, not executed. Everyone knows you. If ≥ 2 evil players are alive, players die instead who attack Trump.

otherNightReminder: Let them choose 1 player. If alive, this player gives 1 coin to the Capitalist. If dead, this player gives 1 vote token to the Capitalist (which they could only use when dead, e.g. with a Mastermind). If they have no coin: the chosen player dies if the Capitalist is a demon else (if the Capitalist is a minion) add 1 "coin debt" or 1 "vote debt" reminder to the chosen player. A player with "coin debt" reminder who earns a coin makes the Capitalist earn it instead and 1 reminder is removed. Analogously for the "vote debt".
name: Capitalist
ability: Each night*, choose 1 player: alives give you 1 coin, deads 1 Vote Token. Else: they die OR (if you are minion) owe it to you. The team with most coins wins.  [You *might* be of minion type, Shopkeeper in play]

name: Wanderer
ability: Each night, choose 1 player: they quit the game until next night and can only rejoin when ≥ 5 players are alive.

name: Spirit of Irony
ability: There can't be more than 1 extra evil player *with respect to actual alignment and in-play demon*.

firstNightReminder: There are no trust effects.
otherNightReminder: Check that you updated who trusts who during the day by adding the "trusted by" reminder to the trustee player. Do not use "trusted by X" or "treason by X" reminders when the player X has a "trust used" reminder. There is only one "trusted by" and "treason by" reminder per player. If the truster supported the execution for their trustee, e.g. a void vote for the executed trustee, indicate the treason by adding the "treason by X" reminder to the trustee player or remember it. With a "treason" reminder, trusters don't get character+alignment info. But if they get it, add the "trust used" reminder to the receiving player until the end of the game. A player with "trust used" reminder is unconscious except for evil players, i.e. their nomination fails, their vote fails and don't wake up except for seeing their character/alignment change). When the truster actively defends a trustee against execution, remove a treason reminder if applicable.
name: Trustmaker
ability: Anyone (you) may declare trust for a player: your vote doesn't register for their nomination. While alive at their deadly execution (not supported by you), you: learn their character+alignment & get – or (if evil) misregister as – unconscious from now on.
flavor: My good friend, as we are forced to leave this dire world, I trust you my secret, I am actually your father.

name: Puzzled Legion
ability: If Legion(atic) is in play, the Puzzledrunk is not a Legion. When the sober+healthy puzzlemaster guesses, they learn a 3rd non-Legion player.

name: Jinxed Puzzlemaster
ability: The Puzzlemaster bypasses misregistration. If the Puzzlemaster guesses themself, they learn *another* non-demon player.

name: Despot
ability: When the politician is mad about ending the game upon their execution (or a character that would), after execution they learn one not-in-play strong good character that is not an evil bluff.

otherNightReminder: If an evil townsfolk or outsider exists, at dawn, when the old Fang Gu is killed and a new Fang Gu is transfered to an outsider, change the alignment of *another* evil townsfolk/outsider and inform them.
name: Probationer
ability: 1 evil townsfolk/outsider turns good when someone else turns evil. [Spirit of Ivory is in play]

name: Mary Sue
ability: Storm-catch a character when it is the only good info character in play. [Storm Catcher is in play]

name: Storm Caught
ability: For this script, storm catching Soulmate, Polymath, Cult Leader and dangerous outsiders (for the Vortox Knight info) is recommended.

name: Alien
ability: The Story Teller might not declare the character of the Traveller.

name: Collaborator
ability: On wakeup, players with minion or demon abilities might get a hint on request (also if drunk) showing ≥ 1 balanced choice. Players still decide on their own.

name: Lunimath
ability: See Polymath Jinxes

name: Gentleman
ability: In an atheist game, the story teller manipulates ≤ 1 person's abilities, misregisters ≤ X players as evil minions/demons, fakes minion signals & has 1 demon ability. [X = regular # of evil]

name: Jinxed Spy
ability: If the Poppy Snitch has their ability, the Spy does not see the Grimoire.

name: Patron
ability: Any player who chooses ≥ 2 people or things doesn't need to only choose distinct people or things.

name: Showmaster
ability: Whenever an outsider effect mentions their team to lose/win, the effect *might* instead turn the outsider into a Heretic and at least the would-be winners learn this.

name: Deranged (State)
ability: All info and terminal effects/events of your abilities on player states are negated. The story teller interprets the negation such that it's detrimental or different from being prudent (normal).

name: Apatheist
ability: Players (not outsiders) can choose without constraint. The story teller does the rest to fit the selection to the game's requirements.

name: Spoiler
ability: The story teller may declare a restriction of or hints about enabled characters/abilities before the game session. No Story Teller nomination with excluded Atheist.

name: Unconscious (State)
ability: You covertly register as dead. You cannot act at day or night. (No ability, no waking up, nominating fails, voting fails.)

name: Jinxed Alsaahir
ability: The Alsaahir's guess applies to the actual character type, else – if incorrect – to the misregistered one.
